title.narrative: ACCESS TO JUSTICE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: Output 3.2 Justice and administrative bodies are able to facilitate children's access to justice services and redress mechanisms, which contributes to Access To Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, disadvantaged children and their families utilise equitable access to justice and social services to prevent and respond to violence, discrimination and family separation

related-activity.ref: 2450/A0/06/003 OUTCOME 3. PROTECTION FROM VIOLENCE, DISCRIMINATION AND CONFLICT PREVENTION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.2 Justice and administrative bodies are able to facilitate children?s access to justice services and redress mechanisms

description.narrative: With support of UNICEF and other partners, criminal legislation – the Criminal Procedure and Misdemeanours Code – was brought in compliance with international standards, including UNCRC. Reconciliation of violence against children (VAC) cases is now prohibited, resulting in criminalization of all cases of VAC. The new Code introduces child-friendly procedures in all criminal processes where children are involved and diversion mechanisms. To support children in legal proceedings, child-friendly, free legal aid in all civil, criminal and administrative procedures involving children has been introduced. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022

title.narrative: Provision of quality legal aid to children in criminal, civil, administrative proceedings at no cost(54614), Text

baseline.value: Limited to children in conflict with the law

target.value: 2022:Expanded to children witness and victims of crime and to children in civil, administrative proceedings at no cost

actual.value: 2021:Approved separate roster available and in use
